title: Rab and his friends and other dogs and men,
author: Brown, John
snippet: Partly from his own personal abstraction from outward country life, and partly from Uncle Johnston's sense of waggery keeping him from telling his friend of the gray's last exploit at Hartree Mill, or her leaping over the " best man " at Thriepland, my father was the last to hear of this equivocal glory of " the minister's meer."
